TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit NTAccount extends System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference

Docs.summary: Represents a user or group account.

MemberSignature.Value: public NTAccount (string name);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name used to create the <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object. This parameter cannot be `null` or an empty string.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> class by using the specified name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The specified name is not required to correspond to an existing account or group, but translation into other <xref:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference>-derived types will not be possible unless the account or group does exist.

MemberSignature.Value: public NTAccount (string domainName, string accountName);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string domainName, string accountName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the domain. This parameter can be `null` or an empty string. Domain names that are null values are treated like an empty string.
The name of the account. This parameter cannot be `null` or an empty string.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> class by using the specified domain name and account name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The specified domain and account names are not required to correspond to an existing account or group, but translation into other <xref:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference>-derived types will not be possible unless the account or group does exist.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool Equals (object o);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object o) cil managed

Docs.param: An object to compare with this <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object, or `null`.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object is equal to a specified object.
Docs.returns: `true` if is an object with the same underlying type and value as this <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object; otherwise, `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int GetHashCode ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Serves as a hash function for the current <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object. The GetHashCode method is suitable for hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
Docs.returns: A hash value for the current <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool IsValidTargetType (Type targetType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsValidTargetType(class System.Type targetType) cil managed

Docs.param:
The type being queried for validity to serve as a conversion from <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount">. The following target types are valid:
\- <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount">
\- <xref:System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier>
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified type is a valid translation type for the <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> class.
Docs.returns: `true` if is a valid translation type for the <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> class; otherwise `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool op_Equality (System.Security.Principal.NTAccount left, System.Security.Principal.NTAccount right);
.method public static hidebysig specialname bool op_Equality(class System.Security.Principal.NTAccount left, class System.Security.Principal.NTAccount right) cil managed

Docs.param: The left operand to use for the equality comparison. This parameter can be `null`.
The right operand to use for the equality comparison. This parameter can be `null`.
Docs.summary: Compares two <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> objects to determine whether they are equal. They are considered equal if they have the same canonical name representation as the one returned by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount.Value%2A> property or if they are both `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool op_Inequality (System.Security.Principal.NTAccount left, System.Security.Principal.NTAccount right);
.method public static hidebysig specialname bool op_Inequality(class System.Security.Principal.NTAccount left, class System.Security.Principal.NTAccount right) cil managed

Docs.param: The left operand to use for the inequality comparison. This parameter can be `null`.
The right operand to use for the inequality comparison. This parameter can be `null`.
Docs.summary: Compares two <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> objects to determine whether they are not equal. They are considered not equal if they have different canonical name representations than the one returned by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount.Value%2A> property or if one of the objects is `null` and the other is not.
Docs.returns: `true` if and are not equal; otherwise `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ToString ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the account name, in *Domain* **\\** *Account* format, for the account represented by the <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference Translate (Type targetType);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference Translate(class System.Type targetType) cil managed

Docs.param: The target type for the conversion from <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount">. The target type must be a type that is considered valid by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount.IsValidTargetType%2A> method.
Docs.summary: Translates the account name represented by the <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object into another <xref:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference>-derived type.

Docs.summary: Returns an uppercase string representation of this <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object.
Docs.value: The uppercase string representation of this <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.NTAccount"> object.
